oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Emancipation Day, Greenwood Park, Monday, Aug. 9, '09
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Embracing Citizenship
Civic Engagement
Slaves -- Emancipation -- United States -- Anniversaries, etc.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Advertisement for the Emancipation Day celebration to be held in Greenwood Park in Nashville.

Following the Civil War, Emancipation Day celebrations traditionally took place on August 8th in Tennessee. This ad published on July 23, 1909 in the Nashville Globe, an African American newspaper, gives the program for the August 9, 1909, celebration at Greenwood Park, an African American park in Nashville. The program was to include a military drill and dress parade commanded by Capt. Henry H. Bowman.
